column4: My system is slowing down/jerking every 1-2 seconds. Everything, if I move a window, or just the cursor, I can see/feel it. One core has a very high workload and I figured out that X is the process which has a high CPU%. I am using Ubuntu 10.10 64-bit with GNOME and an NVIDIA GTX 280 with proprietary drivers from the official Ubuntu repos. I restarted X and GNOME several times, but no...

...effect. I had this problem some weeks ago, but I thought my weak PSU is causing the problem, but now for sure it wasn't the reason because I have a PSU with enough power at all. I completely reinstalled my system since then. The problem was gone but today, it appears again! I found many forums which discuss that problem, it seems to affect a lot of users. But I didn't found a solution so...
...far. Please help, I can't work like that. And reinstall the whole system every month is not the solution. Thanks in advance!
